live out.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if someone lives out, they do not live in the place where they work
live out.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Most home helps prefer to live out.
live out.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to experience or do something that you have planned or hoped for
live out.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The money enabled them to live out their dreams.
live out.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to continue to live in a particular way or place until you die
live out.translation[0].definitions[2].e: He lived out his life in solitude.
